meanings.definition: Pain affecting the back, hip, and outer side of the leg caused by compression of a spinal nerve root in the lower back.
meanings.sent1: My grandma suffers from sciatica and finds it hard to walk.
meanings.sent2: The doctor diagnosed her with sciatica after she complained of shooting pain down her leg.
meanings.sent3: Sciatica decided to visit me right before my big dance performance.
meanings.sent4: The sciatica felt like a lightning bolt striking down my leg.
meanings.sent5: The sciatica was like a persistent, unwelcome guest at the party of my body.

meanings.definition: A condition characterized by pain radiating along the sciatic nerve, which runs down one or both legs from the lower back.
meanings.sent1: His sciatica flared up whenever he tried to bend over to tie his shoes.
meanings.sent2: The athlete had to sit out the game due to severe sciatica affecting his performance.
meanings.sent3: Sciatica seemed to have a sense of humor, striking at the most inconvenient times.
meanings.sent4: The sciatica was like a relentless messenger delivering pain signals to his legs.
meanings.sent5: The sharp, persistent sciatica made each step feel like a battle against invisible forces.
